document.title: Alabama Extended Standards English Language Arts

E05DFE78FE574573A1994852AF8C4DC2.description:
Use a picture, symbol, gesture, or
vocalization to identify current
status.
Examples: Want more, no more,
full; Happy, sad

EA168D73AA794E38B7CEFC21D18D4089.description:
Use a two- or more word negative
phrase.
Examples: Not go, not right, no
want, no thank you

E3F3647D6FBA4BBCA872EF7F477C1D79.description:
Use independent clauses to
express a complete thought.
Examples: The doorbell rang;
The turkey is hot and juicy

F75FC8A99021445E8D082ECC162BEC24.description:
Use compound sentences (i.e.,
sentences with two independent
clauses joined by a coordinating
conjunction).
Examples: It was cold today so I
wore a jacket; I went swimming
and my sister sat in the chair

A1D79994FF6E4DE3899C6D4DFCDF6F65.description:
Use independent clauses to
express a complete thought.
Examples: The doorbell
rang; or the turkey is hot
and juicy

248D209D318044CDB86861447A7AD2E1.description:
Identify the topic of a brief,
informal presentation.
Example: Identify the picture or
tactile representation for a social
greeting after the presentation
about appropriate social greetings

5732FEDFC7BD4E21B8CFEA48BDB1315D.description:
Ask a question about a brief,
informal presentation.

BAF3DD490F894AF2BB7A8B7C44EA8ADD.description:
Identify a point a speaker makes
during a brief, informal
presentation.
Example: Identify a point made
during the teacher’s 2-3 minute
lesson on transportation

F25888B48AC343889FDF615443143F73.description:
Identify 2-3 points a speaker
makes during a presentation (i.e.,
10 minute or more presentation).
Example: Identify 2 points made
during the school resource
officer’s presentation

355B0FAC6B604F00A732287498450198.description:
Identify a point a speaker
makes during a brief,
informal presentation.
Example: Identify a point
made during the teacher’s
2-3 minute lesson on
transportation

D5674D6DB8234FF8AB870FB64235F463.description:
Imitate responding to others with
logic in a difficult situation.
Example: Imitate responding to
name calling with rational
comments rather than with an
outburst as the teacher
demonstrates

40BC8FA0685C42AA9D77329623F2379F.description:
Ask for or give help.
Examples: Ask for help putting
away the papers; Use
communication device to tell
someone how to work a new toy

0D6657F28382457A879AE8AA7FB221C6.description:
Negotiate a position during a
conversation.
Examples: Try to convince a
friend to stop walking and play
ball instead; Persuade a classmate
to take turns with the puppets

AF5D530443C34BC982C1615A1D0A3AA3.description:
Ask for or give help.
Examples: Ask for help
putting away the papers;
Use communication device
to tell someone how to work
a new toy
